text:
"Al-Jinn " is the name of this Surah as well as the title of its subject matter, for in it the event of the Jinn's hearing the Qur'an and returning to their people to preach Islam to them, has been related in detail.

Period of Revelation

According to a tradition related in Bukhari and Muslim, on the authority of Hadrat Abdullah bin Abbas, once the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) was going to Visit the Fair of Ukaz with some of his Companions, On the way be led the Fajr Prayer at Nakhlah. At that time a company of the jinn happened to pass that way. When they heard the Quran being recited, they tarried and listened to it attentively. This very event has been described in this Surah.

Most of the commentators, on the basis of this tradition, believe that this relates to the Holy Prophet's well known journey to Taif, which had taken place three years before the Hijrah in the 10th year of the Prophethood. But this is not correct for several reasons. The jinn's hearing the Qur'an during the journey to Taif has been related in Al-Ahqaf 29-32. A cursory reading of those verses shows that the jinn who had believed after hearing the Qur'an on that occasion were already believers in the Prophet Moses and the previous scriptures. On the contrary, vv. 2-7 of this surah clearly show that the jinn who heard the Qur'an on this occasion were polytheists and deniers of the Hereafter and Prophethood. Then, it is confirmed historically that in his journey to Taif none accompanied the Holy Prophet except Hadrat Zaid bin Harithah. On the contrary, concerning this journey Ibn Abbas says that the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) was accompanied by some of his Companions.
Furthermore, the traditions also agree that in that journey the jinn heard the Qur'an when the Holy Prophet had stopped at Nakhlah on his return journey from Taif to Makkah, and in this journey, according to the traditions of Ibn Abbas, the event of the jinn's hearing the Qur'an occurred when the Holy Prophet was going to Ukaz from Makkah. Therefore, in view of these reasons what seems to be correct is that in Surah Al-Ahqaf and Surah Al Jinn, one and the same event has not been narrated, but these were two separate events, which took place during two separate journeys.

As far as Surah Al-Ahqaf is concerned, it is agreed that the event mentioned in it occurred on the return journey from Taif in the 10th year of Prophethood. As for the question, when this second event took place, its answer is not given by the tradition of Ibn Abbas, nor any other historical tradition shows as to when the Holy Prophet had gone to the Fair of Ukaz along with some of his Companions. However, a little consideration of vv. 8-10 of this surah shows that this could only be an event of the earliest stage of Prophethood. In these verses it has been stated that before the appointment of the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) to Divine Mission the jinn used to have one or another opportunity to eavesdrop in the heavens in order to hear news of the unseen, but after it they suddenly found that angels had been set as guards and meteorites were being shot on every side so that they could find no place of safety from where they could hear the secret news. Thereupon they had set
about searching for the unusual thing that had occurred on the earth, or was going to occur, because of which the security measures had been tightened up. Probably since then many companies of the jinn must have been moving about in search of the unusual occurrence and one of them after having heard the Qur'an from the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) must have formed the opinion that that was the very thing for the sake of which all the gates of the heavens had been shut against the jinn.

Reality of Jinn

Before one starts the study of this Surah one must clearly know what is the reality of the jinn so as to avoid any possible mental confusion. Many people of the modern times are involved in the misunderstanding that the jinn are not real, but only a figment of the ancient superstition and myths. They have not formed this opinion on the basis that they have known all the realities and truths about the universe and have thus discovered that the jinn do not exist. They cannot claim to possess any such knowledge either. But they have assumed without reason and proof that nothing exists in the universe except what they can see, whereas the sphere of human perceptions as against the vastness of this great universe is not even comparable to a drop of water as against the ocean. Here, the person who thinks that what he does not perceive, does not exist, and what exists must necessarily be perceived, in fact, provides a proof of the narrowness of his own mind. With this mode of thought,
not to speak of the jinn, man cannot even accept and acknowledge any reality, which he cannot directly experience and observe, and he cannot even admit the existence of God, to say nothing of admitting any other unseen reality.

Those of the Muslims who have been influenced by modernism, but cannot deny the Qur'an either, have given strange interpretations of the clear statements of the Qur'an about the jinn, Iblis and Satan. They say that this does not refer to any hidden creation, which may have its own independent existence, but it sometimes implies man's own animal forces, which have been called Satan, and sometimes it implies savage and wild mountain tribes, and sometimes the people who used to listen to the Qur'an secretly. But the statements of the Qur'an in this regard are so clear and explicit that these interpretations bear no relevance to them whatever.

The Qur'an frequently mentions the jinn and the men in a manner as to indicate that they are two separate creations. For this, see Al Araf: 38, Hud: 119, Ha Mim As-Sajdah: 25,29, Ahqaf: 18, Adh Dhariyat: 56, and the entire surah Ar-Rahman, which bears such clear evidence as to leave no room to regard the jinn as a human species.

In Surah Al-Araf: 12, Al Hijr: 26-27 and Ar-Rahman: 14-19, it has been expressly stated that man was created out of clay and jinn out of fire.

In Surah Al Hijr: 27, it has been said that the jinn had been created before man. The same thing is testified by the story of Adam and Iblis, which has been told at seven different places in the Qur'an, and at every place it confirms that Iblis was already there at the creation of man. Moreover, in surah Al- Kahf: 50, it has been stated that Iblis belonged to the jinn.

In Surah Al-Araf: 27,, it has been stated in clear words that the jinn see the human beings but the human beings do not see them.

In Surah Al Hijr: 16-18, Surah As-Saaffat: 6-10 and Surah Al-Mulk: 5, it has been said that although the jinn can ascend to the heavens, they cannot exceed a certain limit; if they try to ascend beyond that limit and try to hear what goes on in the heavens, they are not allowed to do so, and if they try to eavesdrop they are driven away by meteorites. By this the belief of the polytheistic Arabs that the jinn possess the knowledge of the unseen, or have access to Divine secrets, has been refuted. The same error has a]so been refuted in Saba: 14.

Al-Baqarah: 30-34 and Al- Kahf: 50 show that Allah has entrusted man with the vicegerency of the earth and the men are superior to the jinn. Although the jinn also have been given certain extraordinary powers and abilities an example of which is found in An-Naml: 39, yet the animals likewise have been given some powers greater than man, but these are no argument that the animals are superior to man.

The Qur'an also explains that the jinn, like men, are a creation possessed of power and authority, and they, just like them, can choose between obedience and disobedience, faith and disbelief. This is confirmed by the story of Satan and the event of the jinn affirming the faith as found in Surahs Al-Ahqaf and Al-Jinn.

At scores of places in the Qur'an, it has also been stated that Iblis at the very creation of Adam had resolved to misguide mankind, and since then the Satanic jinn have been persistently trying to mislead man, but they do not have the power to overwhelm him and make him do something forcibly. However, they inspire him with evil suggestions, beguile him and make evil seem good to him. For this, see An-Nisa: 117-120, Al-Araf: 11-17, Ibrahim: 22, Al-Hijr: 30-42, An-Nahl: 98-100, Bani Israil 61-65.

The Qur'an also tells us that in the pre Islamic ignorance the polytheistic Arabs regarded the jinn as associates of God, worshiped them and thought they were descended from God. For this, see Al-An'am: 100, Saba: 40-41, As Saffat: 158.

From these details, it becomes abundantly clear that the jinn have their own objective existence and are a concealed creation of an entirely different species from man. Because of their mysterious qualities, ignorant people have formed exaggerated notions and concepts about them and their powers, and have even worshiped them, but the Qur'an has explained the whole truth about them, which shows what they are and what they are not.

Theme and Topics

In this Surah in vv. 1-15, it has been told what was the impact of the Qur'an on the company of the jinn when they heard it and what they said to their fellow jinn when they returned to them. Allah, in this connection, has not cited their whole conversation but only those particular things which were worthy of mention. That is why the style is not that of a continuous speech but sentences have been cited so as to indicate that they said this and this. If one studies these sentences spoken by the jinn carefully, one can easily understand the real object of the narration of this event of their affirming the faith and or mentioning this conversation of theirs with their people in the Qur'an. The explanations that we have given of their statements in our Notes will be of further help in understanding this object.

After this, in vv. 16-18, the people have been admonished to the effect:"If you refrain from polytheism and follow the way of righteousness firmly, you will be blessed; otherwise if you turn away from the admonition sent down by Allah, you will meet with a severe punishment." Then, in vv. 19-23, the disbelievers of Makkah have been reproached, as if to say: When the Messenger of Allah calls you towards Allah, you surround and mob him from every side, whereas the only duty of the Messenger is to convey the messages of Allah. He does not claim to have any power to bring any gain or cause any harm to the people." Then, in vv. 24-25 the disbelievers have been warned to the effect: "Today you are trying to overpower and suppress the Messenger seeing that he is helpless and friendless, but a time will come when you will know who in actual fact is helpless and friendless. Whether that time is yet far off, or near at hand, the Messenger has no knowledge thereof, but it will come to pass
in any case." In conclusion, the people have been told: The Knower of the unseen is Allah alone. The Messenger receives only that knowledge which Allah is pleased to give him. This knowledge pertains to matters connected with the performance of the duties of Prophethood and it is delivered to him in such security which does not admit of any external interference whatever.
description: The surah that opens with the revelation that a group of The Jinn listened to the Prophet reciting the Quran, believed in it, and so admonished their own race. It is names after the jinn-kind, whose account is given in its first part. The surah begins with the account of what a group of jinn said when they overheard a recitation of the Quran and realized its truth (verse 1 .). This is a lesson to the Meccan Arabs, who are also told that the Prophet can help them only by delivering the Message—God is the All Powerful One (verse 16 .). The disbelievers are threatened with what they will meet on the Day of Judgement (verse 23 ).The surah is also known as: Jinn-kind, Sprites, The Jinn's, The Spirits.

Efendi Nahi.verse 72:1: Thuaj (o Muhammed!): “Mua m’u ka shpallur se disa prej xhindëve (krijesa të padukshme), kanë dëgjuar dhe kanë thënë: “Me të vërtetë, kemi dëgjuar (një) Kur’an të mrekullueshëm,
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:2: i cili udhëzon në rrugën e drejtë – e ne kemi besuar në të, dhe kurrsesi më nuk do t’i bëjmë shok askë Perëndisë sonë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:3: e, me të vërtetë, qoftë, lartë madhëria e Tij – Zotit tonë! Ai, nuk ka marrë për Vete as bashkëshorte as fëmijë;
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:4: (Disa) të marrët nga ne, flisnin gënjeshtra për Perëndinë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:5: kurse ne, kemi menduar se as njerëzit as xhindët nuk flasin gënjeshtra për Perëndinë;
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:6: e disa njerëz kanë kërkuar strehim te disa xhindë, e kjo vetëm që ua shtoi atyre tërbimin,
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:7: dhe, ata mendojnë siç mendoni edhe ju: se, Perëndia nuk do të ringjallë askë;
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:8: ne jemi ata që kemi arritur në qiell, por kemi hasur në plotë roje të forta (engjëj) dhe shigjeta të zjarrta (meteorë);
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:9: dhe uleshim rreth tij, nëpër vende të përshtatshme për të dëgjuar diçka, por ai që përgjon tani, do të hasë në shigjeta të zjarrta (meteorë) që janë në pritje (pusi),
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:10: dhe ne nuk dimë, se e keqja i qëllimohet atyre që janë në Tokë, apo Zoti i tyre don t’i udhëzojë në rrugë të mirë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:11: e midis nesh ka të mirë dhe ka që nuk janë të mirë, ka prej nesh kategori të ndryshme, (grupe të përçara);
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:12: dhe ne e kemi ditur se nuk do të mund t’i shpëtojmë Perëndisë në Tokë dhe nuk mund ta lodhim Atë duke ikur (në qiell);
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:13: dhe ne, posa dëgjuam udhëzimin (Kur’anin), besuam në të; e kush beson në Zotin e vet, nuk ka përse të druajë nga dëmi as nga zullumi (tërbimi);
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:14: dhe ka prej nesh muslimanë, e ka prej nesh edhe mëkatarë, e kush e ka përqafuar islamizmin, e ka zgjedhur rrugën e drejtë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:15: kurse, jobesimtarët, do të jenë lëndë djegëse të skëterrës”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:16: Sikur të qëndronin në rrugën e vërtetë, Ne do t’i furnizonim me ujë të bollshëm,
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:17: për t’i vënë me këtë në sprovë ata; e kushdo që largohet nga të përkujtuarit Zotin e tij, Zoti atë ia nënshtron dënimit të ashpër.
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:18: Xhamiat i janë kushtuar Perëndisë, dhe mos iu lutni askujt, përveç Perëndisë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:19: E, kur adhuruesi i Perëndisë (Muhammedi), u ngrit t’i lutet Atij, ata (xhindët) u tubuan rreth tij si të ishin shtëllungë leshi.
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:20: Thuaj (o Muhammed!): “Unë i lutem vetëm Zotit tim dhe askë s’ia bëjë shok Atij”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:21: Thuaj (o Muhammed!): “Unë nuk mundem t’jua largojë ndonjë dëm juve e as t’ua sjell ndonjë dobi (vetëm Perëndia ka pushtet për këtë)”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:22: Thuaj (o Muhammed!): “Me të vërtetë, mua askush nuk mund të më mbrojë nga dënimi i Perëndisë; as që mund të gjejë strehim tjetër kund, përveç te Ai, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:23: (Unë s’kam tjetër funksion) përveç që t’ua predikojë atë që vjen nga Perëndia dhe të dërguarit e Tij”. E, ai që s’dëgjon Perëndinë dhe të Dërguarin e Tij, atë e pret zjarri i skëterrës, në të cilin do të mbetet përgjithmonë. –
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:24: E, kur ata të shohin atë për çka u është tërhequr vërejtja, do ta dinë ata se kush është më i dobët (në ndihmë) dhe në numër më i vogël.
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:25: Thuaj (o Muhammed!): “Unë nuk e di, a është afër ajo që u është premtuar juve, apo Zoti im ka caktuar për të afat (më të gjatë),
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:26: vetëm Ai i di sekretet dhe Ai nuk ia zbulon sekretet e Veta askujt;
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:27: përveç atij të cilin Ai e ka zgjedhur për të dërguar (pejgamber); andaj, Ai para tij dhe pas tij, i vë ata që e ruajnë (engjëjt)
Efendi Nahi.verse 72:28: në mënyrë që t’i dijë (qartë) se a i kanë zbatuar misionet e Zotit të tyre. Ai di në hollësi çdo gjë që është te të dërguarit; Ai di numrin e çdo gjëje që ekziston.

null.verse 72:1: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) De: "Mənə vəhy olundu ki, bir dəstə cin (Məkkə və Taif arasında sübh namazı vaxtı Qur'anı dinləyib öz həmcinslərinin yanına qayıtdıqları zaman) dedilər: "Biz çox qəribə (təsəvvür edilməz dərəcədə gözəl olan) bir Qur'an eşitdik.
null.verse 72:2: O, (xalqa) haqq yolu göstərir. Biz ona iman gətirdik və biz bir daha heç kəsi Rəbbimizə şərik qoşmayacağıq.
null.verse 72:3: Həqiqətən, Rəbbimizin calalı çox ucadır. O ?zünə nə bir zövcə götürmüşdür, nə də bir uşaq!
null.verse 72:4: Doğrusu, bizim səfehimiz (İblis) Allah barəsində tamamilə yalan (haqdan uzaq sözlər) söyləyirmiş.
null.verse 72:5: Biz elə güman edirdik ki, nə insan, nə də cin tayfası Allah barəsində yalan danışmaz.
null.verse 72:6: Həqiqətən, (Cahiliyyət dövründə) bə'zi insanlar bir para cinlərə pənah aparır, bununla da onların təkəbbürünü (azğınlığını) artırırdılar (cinlər özləri haqqında çox böyük fikirlərə düşürdülər).
null.verse 72:7: Onlar (o insanlar) da siz (cinlər, yaxud o cinlər də siz insanlar) təkin elə güman edirdilər ki, Allah heç kəsi (öləndən sonra) diriltməyəcəkdir.
null.verse 72:8: Biz (cinlər yuxarı aləm əhlinin söhbətinə oğrun-oğrun qulaq asmaq üçün) göyə qalxmaq istədik (səmanı yoxladıq), amma onun (mələklərdən ibarət) güclü gözətçilər və yandırıb-yaxan (axan) ulduzlarla dolu olduğunu gördük.
null.verse 72:9: Biz (Muhəmməd əleyhissəlamın peyğəmbər göndərilməsindən əvvəl mələklərin söhbətinə) qulaq asmaq üçün (göyün) bə'zi yerlərində otururduq. Lakin indi kim (onların söhbətinə) qulaq asmış olsa, yandırıb-yaxan bir ulduzun onu gözlədiyini görər.
null.verse 72:10: Biz bilmirik ki, (göyün gözətçi mələklərlə, axan ulduzlarla doldurulması və mələklərin söhbətinə qulaq asmağın bizə qadağan edilməsi ilə) yerdə olanlara bir pislik etmək istənilmişdir, yoxsa Rəbbi onlara bir xeyir diləmişdir.
null.verse 72:11: Şübhəsiz ki, aramızda əməlisaleh olanlar da var, olmayanlar da. Biz müxtəlif firqələrə (məzhəblərə) ayrılmışıq.
null.verse 72:12: Biz anladıq ki, yerdə də olsaq, (göyə də) qaçsaq, Allahdan (Allahın əzabından) canımızı qurtara bilmərik (heç yerdə, heç zaman Allahı aciz edə bilmərik).
null.verse 72:13: Doğrusu, biz hidayət yolunu göstərəni (Qur'anı) dinlədiyimiz zaman ona iman gətirdik. Kim Rəbbinə iman gətirsə, nə (yaxşı əməllərinin mükafatını) əskilməsindən, nə də haqsızlığa mə'ruz qalmaqdan (başqasının günahlarının ona yüklənməsindən) qorxar.
null.verse 72:14: Şübhəsiz ki, aramızda (Allaha və Onun Peyğəmbəri Muhəmməd əleyhissəlama iman gətirən) müsəlmanlar da var, (haqq yoldan) çıxanlar da. Müsəlman olanlar haqq yolu axtarıb tapanlardır.
null.verse 72:15: (Haqq yoldan) çıxanlar isə Cəhənnəm üçün odun olacaqlar (orada yandırılacaqlar)"
null.verse 72:16: (Sonra mənə belə vəhy olundu: ) Əgər onlar (Məkkə müşrikləri) o yolda (islam dinində) doğru olsaydılar, Biz onlara (yeddi il davam edən quraqlıq və qıtlıq əsnasında) bol yağış verərdik ki,
null.verse 72:17: Onları bununla (bu ne'mətlə) imtahana çəkək. Kim öz Rəbbini yad etməkdən üz çevirsə, (Allah) onu məşəqqətli bir əzaba düçar edər.
null.verse 72:18: Şübhəsiz ki, (bütün) məscidlər Allaha məxsusdur. Allahdan başqa heç kəsə ibadət etməyin!
null.verse 72:19: Allahın bəndəsi (Muhəmməd əleyhissəlam) Ona ibadət etmək (namaz qılmaq) üçün qalxdıqda (cinlər) az qalmışdı ki, onun ətrafında keçə kimi bir-birinə keçsinlər (izdihamın çoxluğundan bir-birinin üstünə minsinlər).
null.verse 72:20: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) De: "Mən ancaq öz Rəbbimə ibadət edirəm və heç kəsi Ona şərik qoşmuram!"
null.verse 72:21: De: "Mən sizə nə bir zərər, nə də bir xeyir vermək qüdrətinə malik deyiləm! (Bunu ancaq aləmlərin Rəbbi olan Allah edə bilər!)"
null.verse 72:22: De: "Məni Allahdan (Allahın əzabından) heç kəs qurtara bilməz və mən də Ondan başqa heç bir sığınacaq tapa bilmərəm!
null.verse 72:23: (Mənim əlimdən) Allah dərgahından olanı və Onun göndərdiklərini (Qur'anı və dini hökmləri) təbliğ etməkdən başqa (heç bir şey gəlməz). Allah və Onun Peyğəmbərinə asi olanları cəhənnəm odu gözləyir. Onlar orada həmişəlik qalacaqlar!"
null.verse 72:24: Onlar təhdid olunduqlarını (qiyamətdəki, və ya Bədr vuruşundakı əzabı) gördükləri zaman kimin köməkçisinin daha zəif və sayca daha az olduğunu biləcəklər.
null.verse 72:25: De: "Mən sizin qorxudulduğunuz əzabın yaxın olduğunu, yaxud Rəbbimin onun üçün uzun bir müddət tə'yin edəcəyini bilmirəm!
null.verse 72:26: Qeybi bilən ancaq Odur və ?z qeybini heç kəsə əyan etməz;
null.verse 72:27: Bəyənib seçdiyi peyğəmbərdən başqa! (Qeybi nə bir mələk, nə də bir peyğəmbər bilər. Onun açarları ancaq Allahın əlindədir. Lakin Allah istədiyi peyğəmbərə bir mö'cüzə olaraq vəhy yolu ilə qeybdən bə'zi xəbərlər bildirər). Allah onların önündə və arxasında (mələklərdən ibarət) gözətçilər qoyar ki,
null.verse 72:28: (Peyğəmbərlərinin) öz Rəbbinin göndərdiklərini (nə cür) təbliğ etdiyini bilsin (bəlli etsin). (Allah) onlarda olanların hamısını (peyğəmbərlərin əhvalatını və bütün əməllərini ?z elmi ilə) ehtiva etmişdir. O, hər şeyi bir-bir sayıb yazmışdır (təsbit etmişdir)!"

null.verse 72:1: Reci: ”Meni je objavljeno da je nekoliko džina prisluškivalo i reklo: ’Mi smo, doista Kur’an, koji izaziva divljenje, slušali,
null.verse 72:2: koji na pravi put upućuje - i mi smo u nj povjerovali i više nikoga nećemo Gospodaru našem ravnim smatrati’,
null.verse 72:3: a On nije - neka uzvišeno bude dostojanstvo Gospodara našeg! - uzeo sebi ni druge ni djeteta;
null.verse 72:4: jedan naš bezumnik je o Allahu laži govorio,
null.verse 72:5: a mi smo mislili da ni ljudi ni džini o Allahu laži ne govore;
null.verse 72:6: i bilo je ljudi koji su pomoć od džina tražili, pa su im tako obijest povećali;
null.verse 72:7: i oni misle, kao što i vi mislite, da Allah nikoga neće oživiti;
null.verse 72:8: i mi smo nastojali da nebo dotaknemo i utvrdili smo da je moćnih čuvara i zvijezda padalica puno;
null.verse 72:9: i sjedili smo okolo njega po busijama da bismo što čuli, ali će onaj, ko sada prisluškuje, na zvijezdu padalicu koja vreba naići;
null.verse 72:10: i mi ne znamo da li se onima na Zemlji želi zlo ili im Gospodar njihov želi dobro;
null.verse 72:11: a među nama ima i dobrih i onih koji to nisu, ima nas vrsta različitih;
null.verse 72:12: i mi znamo da ne možemo Allahu na Zemlji umaći i da od Njega ne možemo pobjeći;
null.verse 72:13: i mi smo, čim smo Kur’an čuli, u nj povjerovali; a ko u Gospodara svoga vjeruje, ni štete ni nepravde ne treba se bojati;
null.verse 72:14: i ima nas muslimana, a ima nas zalutalih; oni koji islam prihvate Pravi put su izabrali,
null.verse 72:15: a nevjernici će u Džehennemu gorivo biti."
null.verse 72:16: A da se Pravog puta drže, Mi bismo ih vodom obilnom pojili,
null.verse 72:17: da bismo ih time na kušnju stavili; a onoga ko neće da se Gospodaru svome klanja On će u patnju tešku uvesti.
null.verse 72:18: Džamije su Allaha radi, i ne molite se, pored Allaha, nikome!
null.verse 72:19: A kad je Allahov rob ustao da mu se pomoli, oni su se u gomilama oko njega tiskati stali.
null.verse 72:20: Reci: "Ja se samo Gospodaru svome klanjam, i nikoga njemu ravnim ne smatram."
null.verse 72:21: Reci: "Ja nisam u stanju da od vas kakvu štetu otklonim niti da nekom od vas kakvu korist pribavim."
null.verse 72:22: Reci: "Mene niko od Allahove kazne ne može u zaštitu uzeti; samo u Njega ja mogu utočište naći -
null.verse 72:23: samo mogu oglasiti ono što je od Allaha i poslanice Njegove." A onoga koji Allahu i Poslaniku Njegovu ne bude poslušan sigurno čeka vatra džehennemska; u njoj će vječno i zauvijek ostati.
null.verse 72:24: I kada oni dožive ono čime im se prijeti, saznaće ko je slabiji i brojem manji.
null.verse 72:25: Reci: "Ja ne znam da li će uskoro biti ono čime vam se prijeti ili je Gospodar moj odredio da će to poslije dugo vremena biti,
null.verse 72:26: On tajne zna i On tajne svoje ne otkriva nikome,
null.verse 72:27: osim onome koga On za poslanika odabere; zato On i ispred njega i iza njega postavlja one koji će ga čuvati
null.verse 72:28: da bi pokazao da su poslanice Gospodara svoga dostavili, On u tančine zna ono što je u njih, On zna broj svega što postoji.

null.verse 72:1: বলুনঃ আমার প্রতি ওহী নাযিল করা হয়েছে যে, জিনদের একটি দল কোরআন শ্রবণ করেছে, অতঃপর তারা বলেছেঃ আমরা বিস্ময়কর কোরআন শ্রবণ করেছি;
null.verse 72:2: যা সৎপথ প্রদর্শন করে। ফলে আমরা তাতে বিশ্বাস স্থাপন করেছি। আমরা কখনও আমাদের পালনকর্তার সাথে কাউকে শরীক করব না।
null.verse 72:3: এবং আরও বিশ্বাস করি যে, আমাদের পালনকর্তার মহান মর্যাদা সবার উর্ধ্বে। তিনি কোন পত্নী গ্রহণ করেননি এবং তাঁর কোন সন্তান নেই।
null.verse 72:4: আমাদের মধ্যে নির্বোধেরা আল্লাহ তা’আলা সম্পর্কে বাড়াবাড়ির কথাবার্তা বলত।
null.verse 72:5: অথচ আমরা মনে করতাম, মানুষ ও জিন কখনও আল্লাহ তা’আলা সম্পর্কে মিথ্যা বলতে পারে না।
null.verse 72:6: অনেক মানুষ অনেক জিনের আশ্রয় নিত, ফলে তারা জিনদের আত্নম্ভরিতা বাড়িয়ে দিত।
null.verse 72:7: তারা ধারণা করত, যেমন তোমরা মানবেরা ধারণা কর যে, মৃত্যুর পর আল্লাহ তা’আলা কখনও কাউকে পুনরুত্থিত করবেন না।
null.verse 72:8: আমরা আকাশ পর্যবেক্ষণ করছি, অতঃপর দেখতে পেয়েছি যে, কঠোর প্রহরী ও উল্কাপিন্ড দ্বারা আকাশ পরিপূর্ণ।
null.verse 72:9: আমরা আকাশের বিভিন্ন ঘাঁটিতে সংবাদ শ্রবণার্থে বসতাম। এখন কেউ সংবাদ শুনতে চাইলে সে জলন্ত উল্কাপিন্ড ওঁৎ পেতে থাকতে দেখে।
null.verse 72:10: আমরা জানি না পৃথিবীবাসীদের অমঙ্গল সাধন করা অভীষ্ট, না তাদের পালনকর্তা তাদের মঙ্গল সাধন করার ইচ্ছা রাখেন।
null.verse 72:11: আমাদের কেউ কেউ সৎকর্মপরায়ণ এবং কেউ কেউ এরূপ নয়। আমরা ছিলাম বিভিন্ন পথে বিভক্ত।
null.verse 72:12: আমরা বুঝতে পেরেছি যে, আমরা পৃথিবীতে আল্লাহ তা’আলাকে পরাস্ত করতে পারব না এবং পলায়ন করেও তাকে অপারক করত পরব না।
null.verse 72:13: আমরা যখন সুপথের নির্দেশ শুনলাম, তখন তাতে বিশ্বাস স্থাপন করলাম। অতএব, যে তার পালনকর্তার প্রতি বিশ্বাস করে, সে লোকসান ও জোর-জবরের আশংকা করে না।
null.verse 72:14: আমাদের কিছুসংখ্যক আজ্ঞাবহ এবং কিছুসংখ্যক অন্যায়কারী। যারা আজ্ঞাবহ হয়, তারা সৎপথ বেছে নিয়েছে।
null.verse 72:15: আর যারা অন্যায়কারী, তারা তো জাহান্নামের ইন্ধন।
null.verse 72:16: আর এই প্রত্যাদেশ করা হয়েছে যে, তারা যদি সত্যপথে কায়েম থাকত, তবে আমি তাদেরকে প্রচুর পানি বর্ষণে সিক্ত করতাম।
null.verse 72:17: যাতে এ ব্যাপারে তাদেরকে পরীক্ষা করি। পক্ষান্তরে যে ব্যক্তি তার পালনকর্তার স্মরণ থেকে মুখ ফিরিয়ে নেয়, তিনি তাকে উদীয়মান আযাবে পরিচালিত করবেন।
null.verse 72:18: এবং এই ওহীও করা হয়েছে যে, মসজিদসমূহ আল্লাহ তা’আলাকে স্মরণ করার জন্য। অতএব, তোমরা আল্লাহ তা’আলার সাথে কাউকে ডেকো না।
null.verse 72:19: আর যখন আল্লাহ তা’আলার বান্দা তাঁকে ডাকার জন্যে দন্ডায়মান হল, তখন অনেক জিন তার কাছে ভিড় জমাল।
null.verse 72:20: বলুনঃ আমি তো আমার পালনকর্তাকেই ডাকি এবং তাঁর সাথে কাউকে শরীক করি না।
null.verse 72:21: বলুনঃ আমি তোমাদের ক্ষতি সাধন করার ও সুপথে আনয়ন করার মালিক নই।
null.verse 72:22: বলুনঃ আল্লাহ তা’আলার কবল থেকে আমাকে কেউ রক্ষা করতে পারবে না এবং তিনি ব্যতীত আমি কোন আশ্রয়স্থল পাব না।
null.verse 72:23: কিন্তু আল্লাহ তা’আলার বাণী পৌছানো ও তাঁর পয়গাম প্রচার করাই আমার কাজ। যে আল্লাহ ও তাঁর রসূলকে অমান্য করে, তার জন্যে রয়েছে জাহান্নামের অগ্নি। তথায় তারা চিরকাল থাকবে।
null.verse 72:24: এমনকি যখন তারা প্রতিশ্রুত শাস্তি দেখতে পাবে, তখন তারা জানতে পারবে, কার সাহায্যকারী দূর্বল এবং কার সংখ্যা কম।
null.verse 72:25: বলুনঃ আমি জানি না তোমাদের প্রতিশ্রুত বিষয় আসন্ন না আমার পালনকর্তা এর জন্যে কোন মেয়াদ স্থির করে রেখেছেন।
null.verse 72:26: তিনি অদৃশ্যের জ্ঞানী। পরন্ত তিনি অদৃশ্য বিষয় কারও কাছে প্রকাশ করেন না।
null.verse 72:27: তাঁর মনোনীত রসূল ব্যতীত। তখন তিনি তার অগ্রে ও পশ্চাতে প্রহরী নিযুক্ত করেন
null.verse 72:28: যাতে আল্লাহ তা’আলা জেনে নেন যে, রসূলগণ তাঁদের পালনকর্তার পয়গাম পৌছিয়েছেন কি না। রসূলগণের কাছে যা আছে, তা তাঁর জ্ঞান-গোচর। তিনি সবকিছুর সংখ্যার হিসাব রাখেন।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:1: Кажи [о, Мухаммад]: Разкрито ми бе, че няколко джинове слушали и рекли: Чухме удивителен Коран.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:2: Насочва той към правия път. Затова повярвахме в него и никого не ще съдружим с нашия Господ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:3: Той - превисоко е величието на нашия Господ! - не се е сдобивал нито със съпруга, нито със син.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:4: Глупците измежду нас говорят измислици за Аллах.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:5: А ние предполагахме, че хората и джиновете никога не ще изрекат лъжа за Аллах.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:6: Някои хора търсеха убежище при някои джинове, а [хората] им надбавиха безразсъдство.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:7: И [хората] предполагаха, както и вие предполагахте, че Аллах не ще възкреси никого.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:8: И досегнахме небето, и открихме, че е пълно със силна стража и с изгарящи звезди.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:9: А преди седяхме там на места, за да подслушваме. А който подслушва сега, дебне го изгаряща звезда.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:10: И не знаем дали зло е поискано за онези, които са на земята, или техният Господ е поискал добро за тях.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:11: Сред нас има правдиви, сред нас има и други освен това. Следваме различни пътища.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:12: Вече сме убедени, че никога не ще обезсилим Аллах на земята и никога не ще Го обезсилим, дори да бягаме.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:13: И когато чухме Напътствието, повярвахме в него. А който вярва в своя Господ, да не се страхува нито от ощетяване, нито от угнетяване.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:14: Сред нас има отдали се на Аллах [мюсюлмани], но сред нас има и отклонили се [неверници]. Онези, които са се отдали на Аллах - те са избрали правия път.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:15: А отклонилите се - те са горивото за Ада.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:16: И ако се бяха придържали към правия път, Ние щяхме да им дадем вода в изобилие,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:17: за да ги изпитаме с това. А който се отдръпва от споменаването на своя Господ, Той ще го въведе в тежко мъчение.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:18: Джамиите са само за Аллах и затова не зовете никой друг заедно с Аллах!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:19: Когато рабът на Аллах [Мухаммад] се изправи да Го позове, те едва не се струпаха около него на пълчища.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:20: Кажи: Зова единствено моя Господ и никого не съдружавам с Него.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:21: Кажи: Аз нито мога да ви навредя, нито да ви бъда от полза.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:22: Кажи: Никой не може да ме защити от Аллах и не ще намеря убежище освен при Него.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:23: Аз предавам само известие от Аллах и Негови послания. А които не се подчиняват на Аллах и на Неговия Пратеник, за тях е Огънят на Ада, там ще пребивават вечно.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:24: Когато видят обещаното им, ще научат кой има по-слаби и по-малобройни помощници.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:25: Кажи: Не знам близо ли е това, което ви е обещано, или е сторил за него предел моят Господ -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:26: Знаещия неведомото. Той на никого не разкрива Своите тайни,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:27: освен на онзи пратеник, когото е избрал. И сторва Той пред него и зад него да има [ангели] пазители,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 72:28: за да знае, че са съобщили посланията на своя Господ. Обгръща Той това, което е у тях, и пресмята всяко нещо.

null.verse 72:1: 你說：「我曾奉到啟示：有幾個精靈已經靜聽，並且說：『我們確已聽見奇異的《古蘭經》，
null.verse 72:2: 它能導人於正道，故我們信仰它，我們絕不以任何物配我們的主。
null.verse 72:3: 讚頌我們的主的尊嚴！超絕萬物，他沒有擇取妻室，也沒有擇取兒女。
null.verse 72:4: 我們中的庸愚，常以悖謬的事誣蔑真主，
null.verse 72:5: 我們曾猜想人和精靈絕不誣蔑真主。
null.verse 72:6: 曾有一些男人，求些男精靈保護他們，因而使他們更加驕傲。
null.verse 72:7: 那些男人曾像你們一樣猜想真主絕不使任何死者復活。」
null.verse 72:8: 「我們曾試探天，發現天上佈滿堅強的衛士和燦爛的星宿。
null.verse 72:9: 過去，我們為竊聽而常常坐在天上可坐的地方。現在誰去竊聽，誰就發現一顆燦爛的星宿在等著他。
null.verse 72:10: 我們不知道，究竟是大地上的萬物將遭患難呢？還是他們的主欲引他們於正道呢？
null.verse 72:11: 我們中有善良的，有次於善良的，我們是分為許多派別的。
null.verse 72:12: 我們相信，我們在大地上，絕不能使真主無奈，也絕不能逃避真主的譴責。
null.verse 72:13: 當我們聽見正道的時候，我們已信仰它。誰信仰主，誰不怕克扣，也不怕受辱。
null.verse 72:14: 我們中有順服的，有乖張的。凡順服的，都是有志於正道的。
null.verse 72:15: 至於乖張的，將作火獄的燃料。」
null.verse 72:16: 假如他們遵循正道，我必賞賜他們的豐富的雨水，
null.verse 72:17: 以便我以雨水考驗他們。誰退避主的教訓，他將使誰入在嚴峻的刑罰中。
null.verse 72:18: 一切清真寺，都是真主的，故你們應當祈禱真主，不要祈禱任何物。
null.verse 72:19: 當真主的僕人起來祈禱的時候，他們幾乎群起而攻之。
null.verse 72:20: 你說：「我只祈禱我的主，我不以任何物配他。」
null.verse 72:21: 你說：「我不能為你們主持禍福。」
null.verse 72:22: 你說：「任何人不能保護我不受真主的懲罰；除真主外，我絕不能發現任何避難所。
null.verse 72:23: 我只能傳達從真主降示的通知和使命。誰違抗真主和使者，誰必受火獄的刑罰，而且永居其中。
null.verse 72:24: 待他們看見他們所被警告的刑罰的時候，他們就知道誰是更寡助的。」
null.verse 72:25: 你說：「我不知道你們被警告的刑罰是臨近的呢？還是我的主將為它規定一個期限呢？
null.verse 72:26: 他是全知幽玄的，他不讓任何人窺見他的幽玄，
null.verse 72:27: 除非他所喜悅的使者，因為他派遣衛隊，在使者的前面和後面行走，
null.verse 72:28: 以便他知道使者確已傳達了他們的主的使命，並且周知他們所有的言行，而且統計萬物的數目。」

null.verse 72:1: Rci: "Bylo mi vnuknuto, že skupina džinů naslouchala a řekla:, Naslouchali jsme Koránu podivuhodnému,
null.verse 72:2: k přímé cestě vedoucímu, takže jsme v něj uvěřili a již nikoho nebudeme přidružovat k Pánu, svému.
null.verse 72:3: A věru On - povznesena nechť je důstojnost Pána našeho - si nevzal družku ani syna žádného.
null.verse 72:4: Avšak hlupák jeden z nás o Bohu vedl řeči míru přesahující,
null.verse 72:5: ačkoliv jsme se dosud domnívali, že ani lidé, ani džinové o Bohu nebudou vést řeči lživé!
null.verse 72:6: Mužové někteří pak z lidí u mužů z džinů útočiště vyhledali, ti však jen pošetilost jejich rozmnožili
null.verse 72:7: a lidé se - podobně jako vy - že Bůh nikoho nevzkřísí, domnívali.
null.verse 72:8: A prohledali jsme nebe, avšak nalezli jsme je plné stráží silných a plamenů šlehajících.
null.verse 72:9: A sedávali jsme dříve u něho na místech vhodných k naslouchání, však kdokoliv z nás chce naslouchat nyní, ten shledá, že naň číhá plamen šlehající.
null.verse 72:10: A my věru nevíme, zda zlo je zamýšleno pro ty, kdož na zemi dlí, či zda Pán jejich si pro ně přeje správného vedení.
null.verse 72:11: Mezi námi jsou věru bezúhonní a jsou mezi námi zajisté i jiní než takoví, my na sekty jsme rozděleni.
null.verse 72:12: Domníváme se, že nikdy se nám nepodaří uniknout zásahu Božímu na zemi, ba ani pomocí útěku.
null.verse 72:13: A když slyšeli jsme o správném vedení, uvěřili jsme v ně; a ten, kdo v Pána svého věří, ať nebojí se ani poškození, ani útlaku.
null.verse 72:14: A jsou mezi námi ti, kdož do vůle Boží se odevzdali, a jiní, kteří nespravedliví jsou. A ten, kdo do vůle Boží se odevzdal, ten ubírá se cestou správnou.
null.verse 72:15: Co nespravedlivých se týká, ti peklu palivem budou.? "
null.verse 72:16: A půjdou-li touto cestou, My věru je napojíme vodou hojnou,
null.verse 72:17: abychom je zkoušeli. Kdokoliv však se odvrátí od připomenutí Pána svého, toho On uvede do trestu těžkého.
null.verse 72:18: A modlitebny patří Bohu; nevzývejte v nich tedy spolu s Bohem nikoho!
null.verse 72:19: A když povstal služebník Boží, vzývaje Jej, tu div se proti němu nezvedli v hustém zástupu.
null.verse 72:20: Rci: "Já modlím se pouze k Pánu svému a nikoho nepřidružuji k Němu."
null.verse 72:21: Rci: "Nevládnu mocí způsobit vám škodu, či abyste správně byli vedeni.
null.verse 72:22: Rci: "Neochrání mě před Bohem nikdo a nenaleznu útočiště žádné kromě Něho,
null.verse 72:23: kromě sdělení od Boha a Jeho poselství. Těm, kdo neposlouchají Boha a Jeho posla, těm určen je oheň pekelný a budou v něm navěky nesmrtelní.
null.verse 72:24: A až spatří to, co jim bylo slíbeno, poznají, kdo pomocníky má nejslabší a kdo počtem je nejmenší."
null.verse 72:25: Rci: "Nevím, zda je blízko to, co vám bylo slíbeno, či zda Pán můj dá odklad tomu další;
null.verse 72:26: On jediný zná nepoznatelné a nikoho do svých tajemství nezasvěcuje
null.verse 72:27: kromě těch, jež oblíbil si ze Svých poslů; a před ním i za ním dozorce kráčí,
null.verse 72:28: aby zjistil, zda poselství Pána svého hlásá. A On Svým věděním vše, co konají, objímá a On každou věc přesným počtem počítá.

null.verse 72:1: Zeg: "Het is aan mij geopenbaard dat een groep van djinns heeft geluisterd (naar de Koran), en zij zeiden: ’Waarlijk, wij hebben een wonderbaarlijke verkondiging gehoord!
null.verse 72:2: Die tot rechtschapenheid leidt; daarom hebben wij er in geloofd, en wij zullen stellig niemand met onze Heer vereenzelvigen.
null.verse 72:3: En de Majesteit van onze Heer is hoog verheven. Hij heeft noch echtgenote noch zoon.
null.verse 72:4: En voorzeker, de dwaas onder ons placht over God leugen te spreken.
null.verse 72:5: Doch wij hadden gemeend dat mensen en djinns nooit een leugen over God zouden uiten.
null.verse 72:6: Voorzeker, waren er enige mensen die toevlucht bij sommige djinns zochten, waardoor zij hun zonden vermeerderden.
null.verse 72:7: En zij meenden inderdaad, zoals jullie meenden, dat God nooit een boodschapper zou zenden.
null.verse 72:8: En wij trachtten de hemel te bespieden en wij vonden deze vol sterke wachters en vlammen.
null.verse 72:9: En voorzeker, wij plachten op enige plaatsen te zitten om de gesprekken te beluisteren. Maar wie nu luistert, vindt een vlam die op hem wacht.
null.verse 72:10: Wij weten daardoor niet of voor degenen die op aarde zijn, een ramp wordt bedoeld of dat hun Heer hen op het goede pad wil leiden.
null.verse 72:11: Er zijn onder ons die rechtvaardig zijn en er zijn onder ons die anders zijn en wij volgen verschillende wegen.
null.verse 72:12: En wij beseffen dat wij God’s (plan) op aarde onmogelijk kunnen verijdelen, noch kunnen wij Hem door de vlucht ontlopen.
null.verse 72:13: En toen wij de leiding hoorden, geloofden wij er in. En hij, die gelooft in zijn Heer, heeft geen vrees voor verlies of onrecht.
null.verse 72:14: En er zijn onder ons Moslims die van het rechte pad zijn afgeweken. En zij die zich onderwerpen - hebben de rechte weg gezocht.
null.verse 72:15: En zij die van het rechte pad afwijken, zullen brandstof der hel zijn.’"
null.verse 72:16: Indien zij zich aan het rechte pad houden zullen Wij hun water in overvloed te drinken geven,
null.verse 72:17: Om hen daarmee op de proef te stellen. En wie zich van de gedachte aan zijn Heer afwendt, Hij zal hem een toenemende straf toedienen.
null.verse 72:18: En zeg: "Alle bedehuizen behoren aan God; roept daarom niemand naast God aan."
null.verse 72:19: En toen de dienaar van God opstond om Hem te aanbidden, vielen zij hem bijna aan.
null.verse 72:20: Zeg: "Ik bid alleen tot mijn Heer en ik vereenzelvig niemand met Hem."
null.verse 72:21: Zeg: "Ik heb (uit mijzelf) geen macht u goed of kwaad te doen."
null.verse 72:22: Zeg: "Voorzeker, niemand kan mij tegen God beschermen, noch kan ik een andere schuilplaats vinden buiten Hem -
null.verse 72:23: (Mij is) slechts de verkondiging van God’s boodschap opgedragen." En voor degenen die God en Zijn boodschapper niet gehoorzamen is het Vuur der hel, waarin zij lange tijd zullen vertoeven,
null.verse 72:24: Tot zij de straf zien waarmee zij worden bedreigd, maar dan zullen zij ook weten wie zwakkere helpers en kleiner aantal heeft.
null.verse 72:25: Zeg hun: "Ik weet niet of hetgeen waarmede gij bedreigd wordt nabij is of wel dat mijn Heer het zal uitstellen voor een lange tijd."
null.verse 72:26: Hij is de Kenner van het onzienlijke en Hij geeft niemand overvloedig kennis van Zijn geheimen.
null.verse 72:27: Behalve hem die Hij als boodschapper kiest. Dan doet Hij een wacht vóór hem en achter hem gaan,
null.verse 72:28: Opdat Hij moge weten dat zij (Zijn boodschappers) de boodschappen van hun Heer hebben overgebracht. En Hij omvat alles wat met hen is - en Hij heeft alles berekend.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:1: Say (O Muhammad): It is revealed unto me that a company of the Jinn gave ear, and they said: Lo! we have heard a marvellous Qur’an,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:2: Which guideth unto righteousness, so we believe in it and we ascribe no partner unto our Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:3: And (we believe) that He - exalted be the glory of our Lord! - hath taken neither wife nor son,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:4: And that the foolish one among us used to speak concerning Allah an atrocious lie.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:5: And lo! we had supposed that humankind and jinn would not speak a lie concerning Allah -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:6: And indeed (O Muhammad) individuals of humankind used to invoke the protection of individuals of the jinn, so that they increased them in revolt against Allah);
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:7: And indeed they supposed, even as ye suppose, that Allah would not raise anyone (from the dead) -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:8: And (the Jinn who had listened to the Qur’an said): We had sought the heaven but had found it filled with strong warders and meteors.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:9: And we used to sit on places (high) therein to listen. But he who listeneth now findeth a flame in wait for him;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:10: And we know not whether harm is boded unto all who are in the earth, or whether their Lord intendeth guidance for them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:11: And among us there are righteous folk and among us there are far from that. We are sects having different rules.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:12: And we know that we cannot escape from Allah in the earth, nor can we escape by flight.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:13: And when we heard the guidance, we believed therein, and whoso believeth in his Lord, he feareth neither loss nor oppression.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:14: And there are among us some who have surrendered (to Allah) and there are among us some who are unjust. And whoso hath surrendered to Allah, such have taken the right path purposefully.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:15: And as for those who are unjust, they are firewood for hell.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:16: If they (the idolaters) tread the right path, We shall give them to drink of water in abundance
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:17: That We may test them thereby, and whoso turneth away from the remembrance of his Lord; He will thrust him into ever-growing torment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:18: And the places of worship are only for Allah, so pray not unto anyone along with Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:19: And when the slave of Allah stood up in prayer to Him, they crowded on him, almost stifling.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:20: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): I pray unto Allah only, and ascribe unto Him no partner.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:21: Say: Lo! I control not hurt nor benefit for you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:22: Say: Lo! none can protect me from Allah, nor can I find any refuge beside Him
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:23: (Mine is) but conveyance (of the Truth) from Allah, and His messages; and whoso disobeyeth Allah and His messenger, lo! his is fire of hell, wherein such dwell for ever.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:24: Till (the day) when they shall behold that which they are promised (they may doubt); but then they will know (for certain) who is weaker in allies and less in multitude.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:25: Say (O Muhammad, unto the disbelievers): I know not whether that which ye are promised is nigh, or if my Lord hath set a distant term for it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:26: (He is) the Knower of the Unseen, and He revealeth unto none His secret,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:27: Save unto every messenger whom He hath chosen, and then He maketh a guard to go before him and a guard behind him
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 72:28: That He may know that they have indeed conveyed the messages of their Lord. He surroundeth all their doings, and He keepeth count of all things.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:1: Say: It has been revealed to me that a company of Jinns listened (to the Qur’an). They said, ’We have really heard a wonderful Recital!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:2: ’It gives guidance to the Right, and we have believed therein: we shall not join (in worship) any (gods) with our Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:3: ’And Exalted is the Majesty of our Lord: He has taken neither a wife nor a son.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:4: ’There were some foolish ones among us, who used to utter extravagant lies against God;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:5: ’But we do think that no man or spirit should say aught that untrue against God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:6: ’True, there were persons among mankind who took shelter with persons among the Jinns, but they increased them in folly.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:7: ’And they (came to) think as ye thought, that God would not raise up any one (to Judgment).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:8: ’And we pried into the secrets of heaven; but we found it filled with stern guards and flaming fires.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:9: ’We used, indeed, to sit there in (hidden) stations, to (steal) a hearing; but any who listen now will find a flaming fire watching him in ambush.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:10: ’And we understand not whether ill is intended to those on earth, or whether their Lord (really) intends to guide them to right conduct.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:11: ’There are among us some that are righteous, and some the contrary: we follow divergent paths.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:12: ’But we think that we can by no means frustrate God throughout the earth, nor can we frustrate Him by flight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:13: ’And as for us, since we have listened to the Guidance, we have accepted it: and any who believes in his Lord has no fear, either of a short (account) or of any injustice.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:14: ’Amongst us are some that submit their wills (to God), and some that swerve from justice. Now those who submit their wills - they have sought out (the path) of right conduct:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:15: ’But those who swerve,- they are (but) fuel for Hell-fire’-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:16: (And God’s Message is): "If they (the Pagans) had (only) remained on the (right) Way, We should certainly have bestowed on them Rain in abundance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:17: "That We might try them by that (means). But if any turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to undergo a severe Penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:18: "And the places of worship are for God (alone): So invoke not any one along with God;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:19: "Yet when the Devotee of God stands forth to invoke Him, they just make round him a dense crowd."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:20: Say: "I do no more than invoke my Lord, and I join not with Him any (false god)."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:21: Say: "It is not in my power to cause you harm, or to bring you to right conduct."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:22: Say: "No one can deliver me from God (If I were to disobey Him), nor should I find refuge except in Him,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:23: "Unless I proclaim what I receive from God and His Messages: for any that disobey God and His Apostle,- for them is Hell: they shall dwell therein for ever."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:24: At length, when they see (with their own eyes) that which they are promised,- then will they know who it is that is weakest in (his) helper and least important in point of numbers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:25: Say: "I know not whether the (Punishment) which ye are promised is near, or whether my Lord will appoint for it a distant term.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:26: "He (alone) knows the Unseen, nor does He make any one acquainted with His Mysteries,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:27: "Except an apostle whom He has chosen: and then He makes a band of watchers march before him and behind him,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 72:28: "That He may know that they have (truly) brought and delivered the Messages of their Lord: and He surrounds (all the mysteries) that are with them, and takes account of every single thing."

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:1: Say: ’It has been revealed to me that a company of the jinn gave ear, then they said, "We have indeed heard a Koran wonderful,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:2: guiding to rectitude. We believe in it, and we will not associate with our Lord anyone.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:3: He -- exalted be our Lord’s majesty! has not taken to Himself either consort or a son.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:4: The fool among us spoke against God outrage,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:5: and we had thought that men and jinn would never speak against God a lie.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:6: But there were certain men of mankind who would take refuge with certain men of the jinn, and they increased them in vileness,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:7: and they thought, even as you also thought, that God would never raise up anyone.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:8: And we stretched towards heaven, but we found it filled with terrible guards and meteors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:9: We would sit there on seats to hear; but any listening now finds a meteor in wait for him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:10: And so we know not whether evil is intended for those in the earth, or whether their Lord intends for them rectitude.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:11: And some of us are the righteous, and some of us are otherwise; we are sects differing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:12: Indeed, we thought that we should never be able to frustrate God in the earth, neither be able to frustrate Him by flight.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:13: When we heard the guidance, we believed in it; and whosoever believes in his Lord, he shall fear neither paltriness nor vileness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:14: And some of us have surrendered, and some of us have deviated. Those who have surrendered sought rectitude;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:15: but as for those who have deviated, they have become firewood for Gehenna!"’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:16: Would they but go straight on the way, We would give them to drink of water copious,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:17: that We might try them therein. And whosoever turns away from the Remembrance of his Lord, He will thrust him into chastisement rigorous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:18: The places of worship belong to God; so call not, along with God, upon anyone.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:19: When the servant of God stood calling on Him, they were wellnigh upon him in swarms.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:20: Say: ’I call only upon my Lord, and I do not associate with Him anyone.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:21: Say: ’Surely I possess no power over you, either for hurt or for rectitude.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:22: Say: ’From God shall protect me not anyone, and I shall find, apart from Him, no refuge,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:23: excepting a Deliverance from God and His Messages. And whoso rebels against God and His messenger, for him there awaits the Fire of Gehenna; therein they shall dwell forever.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:24: Until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and fewer in numbers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:25: Say: ’I do not know whether that which you are promised is nigh, or whether my Lord will appoint for it a space;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:26: Knower He of the Unseen, and He discloses not His Unseen to anyone,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:27: save only to such a Messenger as He is well-pleased with; then He despatches before him and behind him watchers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 72:28: that He may know they have delivered the Messages of their Lord; and He encompasses all that is with them, and He has numbered everything in numbers.’

Muhammad Asad.verse 72:1: SAY: "It has been revealed to me that some of the unseen beings gave ear [to this divine writ], and thereupon said [unto their fellow-beings]: "‘Verily, we have heard a wondrous discourse,
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:2: guiding towards consciousness of what is right; and so We have come to believe in it. And we shall never ascribe divinity to anyone beside our Sustainer,
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:3: for [we know] that sublimely exalted is our Sustainer’s majesty: no consort has He ever taken unto Himself, nor a son!
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:4: "‘And [now we know] that the foolish among us were wont to say outrageous things about God,
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:5: and that [we were mistaken when] we thought that neither man nor [any of] the invisible forces would ever tell a lie about God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:6: Yet [it has always happened] that certain kinds of humans would seek refuge with certain kinds of [such] invisible forces: but these only increased their confusion
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:7: so much so that they came to think, as you [once] thought, that God would never [again] send forth anyone [as His apostle].
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:8: "‘And [so it happened] that we reached out towards heaven: but we found it filled with mighty guards and flames,
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:9: notwithstanding that we were established in positions [which we had thought well-suited] to listening to [whatever secrets might be in] it: and anyone who now [or ever] tries to listen will [likewise] find a flame lying in wait for him!
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:10: "‘And [now we have become aware] that we [created beings] may not know whether evil fortune is intended for [any of] those who live on earth, or whether it is their Sustainer’s will to endow them with consciousness of what is right:
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:11: just as [we do not know how it happens] that some from among us are righteous, while some of us are [far] below that: we have always followed widely divergent paths.
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:12: "‘And, withal, we have come to know that we can never elude God [while we live] on earth, and that we can never elude Him by escaping [from life].
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:13: Hence, as soon as we heard this [call to His] guidance, we came to believe in it: and he who believes in his Sustainer need never have fear of loss or injustice.
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:14: "‘Yet [it is true] that among us are such as have surrendered themselves to God – just as there are among us such as have abandoned themselves to wrongdoing. Now as for those who surrender themselves to Him – it is they that have attained to consciousness of what is right;
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:15: but as for those who abandon themselves to wrongdoing – they are indeed but fuel for [the fires of] hell!’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:16: [KNOW,] THEN, that if they [who have heard Our call] keep firmly to the [right] path, We shall certainly shower them with blessings abundant,
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:17: so as to test them by this means: for he who shall turn away from the remembrance of his Sustainer, him will He cause to undergo suffering most grievous.
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:18: And [know] that all worship is due to God [alone]: hence, do not invoke anyone side by side with God!
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:19: Yet [thus it is] that whenever a servant of God stands up in prayer to Him, they [who are bent on denying the truth] would gladly overwhelm him with their crowds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:20: Say: "I invoke my Sustainer alone, for I do not ascribe divinity to anyone beside Him."
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:21: Say: "Verily, it is not in my power to cause you harm or to endow you with consciousness of what is right."
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:22: Say: "Verily, no one could ever protect me from God, nor could I ever find a place to hide from Him
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:23: if I should fail to convey [to the world whatever illumination comes to me] from God and His messages." Now as for him who rebels against God and His Apostle – verily, the fire of hell awaits him, therein to abide beyond the count of time.
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:24: [Let them, then, wait] until the time when they behold that [doom] of which they were forewarned: for then they will come to understand which [kind of man] is more helpless and counts for less!
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:25: Say: "I do not know whether that [doom] of which you were forewarned is near, or whether my Sustainer has set for it a distant term."
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:26: He [alone] knows that which is beyond the reach of a created being’s perception, and to none does He disclose aught of the mysteries of His Own unfathomable knowledge,
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:27: unless it be to an apostle whom He has been pleased to elect [therefor]: and then He sends forth [the forces of heaven] to watch over him in whatever lies open before him and in what is beyond his ken
Muhammad Asad.verse 72:28: so as to make manifest that it is indeed [but] their Sustainer’s messages that these [apostles] deliver: for it is He who encompasses [with His knowledge] all that they have [to say], just as He takes count, one by one, of everything [that exists].

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:1: Say, “It has been revealed to me that a group from Jinn has listened (to the Qur’ān), and said (to their people), ‘Indeed we have heard an amazing Recital (Qur’ān)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:2: that guides to the right way, so we have believed in it, and we will never associate a partner with our Lord.’
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:3: and (then the Jinns started talking to each other) that exalted is the Glory of our Lord; He has taken neither a wife, nor a son,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:4: and that the fools among us used to attribute to Allah extremely absurd things,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:5: and that we thought that the humans and the Jinn would never tell a lie about Allah, (therefore, we had followed them in shirk under this impression),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:6: and that some guys from human beings used to seek refuge with some guys of the Jinn, and thus they increased them (the Jinns) in arrogance,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:7: and that they (humans) thought as you (O Jinns) thought that Allah will never resurrect anyone,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:8: and that we sought (to reach) the sky, but we found it filled with stern guards and flames,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:9: and that we used to sit at places therein to listen; but if one will (try to) listen now, he will find a flame in ambush for him,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:10: and that we do not know whether it is a bad end that is intended for those on earth, or their Lord has intended for them a right thing,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:11: and that some of us are (already) righteous, and some of us are otherwise, and we were on different ways;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:12: and that we have now believed that we can never frustrate Allah on the earth, nor can we baffle Him by escape,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:13: and that when we heard the Guiding Discourse, we believed in it; so if one believes in his Lord, he will have no fear of either any curtailment (in his reward) or any excess (in his punishment),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:14: and that some of us are Muslims, and some of us are unjust. Now, those who submitted to Islam have found out the right path,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:15: As for the unjust, they have become firewood for Hell.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:16: “(And it is also revealed to me) that if they (the people of Makkah) had stood firm on the (right) way, We would have supplied water to them in abundance,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:17: so that We test them thereby; and if one turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will thrust him into a severe torment,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:18: and that masājid (mosques) belong to Allah; so, do not invoke anyone along with Allah,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:19: and that when Allah’s servant stood invoking Him, they almost rushed on him in crowds.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:20: Say, “I invoke my Lord, and do not associate anyone with Him.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:21: Say, “I possess no power to cause you any harm or bring you to a right way.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:22: Say, “No one can ever save me from Allah, and I can never find a refuge save with Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:23: However, (I have been given power) of conveying (commands) from Allah, and His messages. The one who disobeys Allah and His Messenger, for him there is the fire of Hell, wherein such people will live forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:24: (The disbelievers will continue denying the truth and mock at it) until when they will see what they are promised, they will know whose supporters are weaker, and whose numbers are less.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:25: Say, “I do not know whether that which you are promised is near, or my Lord has appointed for it a distant term.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:26: (He is the) Knower of the Unseen. So He does not let anyone know the Unseen created by Him,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:27: except a messenger whom He chooses (to inform through revelation), and then He appoints (angels as) watching guards before him and behind him, (so that devils may not tamper with the divine revelation,)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 72:28: so that He knows that they (angels) have conveyed the messages of their Lord. And He has encompassed all that is with them, and has comprehensive knowledge of every thing by numbers.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:1: Say: ‘It has been revealed to me that a company of the jinn listened, then said: “We have indeed heard a marvellous Qur’ān,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:2: which guides to rectitude. Therefore we believe in it and we will never associate anyone with our Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:3: And [we believe] that exalted be the majesty of our Lord; He has taken neither spouse nor son.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:4: And that the fool among us used to utter atrocious lies against God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:5: And we thought that humans and jinn would never utter a lie against God,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:6: And that certain individuals of mankind used to seek the protection of certain individuals of the jinn so that they increased them in oppressiveness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:7: And they thought just as you thought, that God would never raise anyone.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:8: And we made for the heaven, but we found it filled with mighty guards and meteors.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:9: And we used to sit in [certain] places therein to listen in; but anyone listening now will find a meteor lying in wait for him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:10: And we do not know whether ill is intended for those who are in the earth, or whether their Lord intends for them good.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:11: And that among us some have become righteous and some of us are otherwise; we are [made up of] different sects.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:12: And we assume that we will never be able to elude God in the earth, nor will we be able to elude Him by fleeing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:13: And that when we heard the guidance, we believed in it. For whoever believes in his Lord shall fear neither loss nor oppression.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:14: And that among us some have submitted [to God], while some of us are unjust. So whoever has submitted [to God], those are the ones who seek right guidance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:15: And as for those are unjust, they will be firewood for Hell!” ’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:16: And [it has been revealed to me] that if they adopt the [right] path, We will give them abundant water to drink,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:17: so that We may try them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, We will admit him into a tortuous chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:18: And [it has been revealed to me] that the places of prayer belong to God, so do not invoke anyone along with God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:19: And that when the servant of God rose to invoke Him, they were almost upon him in heaps.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:20: He said, ‘I invoke only my Lord, and I do not associate anyone with Him’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:21: Say: ‘I truly have no power to bring you any harm or any guidance’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:22: Say: ‘Indeed none shall protect me from God, and I shall never find besides Him any refuge.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:23: I have power to bring you] only a communication from God and His Messages. And whoever disobeys God and His Messenger, indeed there will be for him the fire of Hell, abiding therein forever’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:24: Such that when they see what they are promised, they will then know who is weaker in supporters and fewer in numbers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:25: Say: ‘I do not know if what you are promised is near, or if my Lord has set a [distant] length for it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:26: Knower [He is] of the Unseen and He does not disclose His Unseen to anyone,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:27: except to a messenger of whom He approves. Then, He despatches before him and behind him watchers,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 72:28: so that He may know that they have conveyed the Messages of their Lord, and He encompasses all that is with them and keeps count of all things’.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:1: Say: ‘It has been revealed to me that a party of the jinn listened to (my recitation) carefully and then (went back to their people and) said: Surely, we have heard a wonderful Qur’an.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:2: It shows the path of guidance. So we have believed in it and will never set up any partner with our Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:3: And that exalted is the Glory of our Lord. He has taken for Himself neither any wife nor any children.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:4: And that only a fool from amongst us used to utter things about Allah far from the truth, crossing bounds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:5: And that we thought that man and jinn would never tell a lie against Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:6: And that some of the men used to take shelter with some of the jinn. So they increased defiance amongst the jinn.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:7: And, (O party of jinn,) those men also thought just as you thought that Allah would never raise up anyone (after death).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:8: And that we touched the heavens and found them filled with high-alert guards and stars shining and burning (like brands).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:9: And that we used to sit on certain seats (in the heavens previously, to listen to the news), but if someone now seeks to listen, then he will find a flame of fire (waiting) for him in ambush.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:10: And that we do not know whether some evil has been intended (by our restriction) in respect of those people who are in the earth, or their Lord intends some good for them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:11: And that amongst us are some who are pious and there are also some (evil) exceptions amongst us. We were (following) different ways.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:12: And we have ascertained that we can by no means come in the way of Allah (whilst living) in the earth, nor can we thwart Him by escaping (from the earth).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:13: And that when we listened to (the Book of) Guidance, we believed in it. Then he who believes in his Lord fears neither loss nor injustice.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:14: And that (some) of us are obedient and (some) of us are wrongdoers as well. So he who becomes obedient, it is they who seek righteousness.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:15: And as for the wrongdoers, they will be the fuel of Hell.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:16: And this (Revelation has also come to me) that if they had remained firm on the right path (the path of truth, the path of the remembrance of Allah), then We would have provided them with abundant water,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:17: So that We put them to trial by this blessing. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to enter a severe torment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:18: And that mosques are (specified) for Allah alone. So never worship anyone else besides Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:19: And that when the servant of Allah (Muhammad [blessings and peace be upon him]) stood up to worship Him, they thronged around him (to listen to his recitation).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:20: Say: ‘I worship only my Lord and do not associate any partner with Him.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:21: Say: ‘I do not possess any power to do you harm (i.e., make you disbelieve) or to do you good (i.e., make you believe. So Allah is the real Lord. I am a mediator and means).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:22: Say: ‘Neither can anyone shelter me from a torment (against the command) of Allah, nor can I ever find refuge apart from Him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:23: But (my responsibility is) to communicate from Allah His commands and messages. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him), surely there is for him the Fire of Hell in which they will live forever.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:24: Until, when they will see that torment which is being promised to them, (then) they will come to know who is weaker in helpers and fewer in numbers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:25: Say: ‘I do not know whether that (Day of Rising) which is being promised to you is near, or my Lord has appointed a longer term for that.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:26: (He is) the Knower of the unseen. So He does not inform any (common man) of His unseen,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:27: Except for His Messengers with whom He is well-pleased (and reveals to them alone the unseen because that is an exclusive trait of Prophethood and a Messenger’s miracle as well). So indeed He appoints protectors at both front and rear of him (the Messenger, for the security of the knowledge of the unseen),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 72:28: So that Allah may bring to light that surely they (the Messengers) have communicated the messages of their Lord, and Allah has (already) encompassed what they have (of Allah’s injunctions and the knowledge of the unseen) and He has kept count of everything.

null.verse 72:1: Sano: »Minulle on ilmoitettu, että osa dzinneistä kuunteli ja sanoi: 'Totisesti olemme kuulleet luettavan ihmeellistä Koraania,
null.verse 72:2: joka ohjaa oikeaan, ja me uskomme siihen emmekä koskaan tahdo asettaa ketään muuta Jumalamme rinnalle.
null.verse 72:3: Totisesti Hän ei - ääretön on Herramme majesteetti - ole ottanut vaimoa eikä lasta.
null.verse 72:4: Vain mielettömät joukostamme sepittävät sopimattomia asioita Jumalasta;
null.verse 72:5: totisesti ajattelimme, etteivät ihmiset eivätkä dzinnit lausuisi valhetta Jumalaa vastaan,
null.verse 72:6: ja että ihmisten joukosta muutamilla oli tapana paeta eräiden dzinnien turviin, ja nämä yllyttivät heitä pöyhkeyteen.
null.verse 72:7: Totisesti he luulivat aivan niin kuin te, että Jumala ei herätä ketään kuolleista.
null.verse 72:8: (ja Koraania kuulleet dzinnit lisäsivät:) Me todellakin etsimme nousua taivaaseen, mutta havaitsimme sen olevan täynnä voimakkaita vartijoita ja liekkejä.
null.verse 72:9: Katso, meillä oli tapana istua muutamilla paikoilla kuullaksemme, mutta se, joka nyt yrittää kuunnella, kohtaa hänelle varatun liekin.
null.verse 72:10: Emmekä todella tiedä, onko se pahaa, mikä on tarkoitettu maan päällä eläville, vai tarkoittaako heidän Herransa heille oikeaa ohjausta.
null.verse 72:11: Totisesti on joukossamme niitä, jotka ovat hyviä, ja myös sellaisia, jotka eivät ole; me olemme jakaantuneet eri lahkokuntiin.
null.verse 72:12: Katso, me uskomme, ettemme milloinkaan voi päästä Jumalaa pakoon täällä maan päällä, emmekä pääse Hänestä lentämälläkään.
null.verse 72:13: Totisesti uskoimme johdatukseen, kun saimme kuulla sen; ja sen, joka uskoo Herraan, ei tarvitse pelätä tappiota eikä yllättävää pahaa.
null.verse 72:14: Joukostamme ovat eräät totisesti Herralle alistuneita muslimeja, ja toiset jumalattomia. Ne, jotka ovat muslimeja, ovat niitä, joiden päämääränä on vanhurskaus.
null.verse 72:15: Mitä taasen tulee jumalattomiin, kuluttaa heidät helvetin tuli.
null.verse 72:16: (Sano myös:) Jos he pysyvät oikealla tiellä, me annamme heille juomavettä runsain määrin
null.verse 72:17: koetellaksemme heitä siten; mutta jos joku kääntyy pois unohtaen Herransa, valmistaa Hän hänelle loppumattoman vaivan.
null.verse 72:18: Totisesti, temppelit kuuluvat Jumalalle, älkää siis huutako avuksi ketään muuta kuin Jumalaa!
null.verse 72:19: Ja kun Jumalan palvelija nousi huutaen Hänen puoleensa, olivat he vähällä tallata hänet tungoksessa.
null.verse 72:20: Sano: »Minä käännyn vain Herrani puoleen enkä aseta ketään Hänen rinnalleen.»
null.verse 72:21: Sano: »Totisesti, minulla ei ole valtaa tuottaa teille pahaa eikä hyvää.»
null.verse 72:22: Sano: »Totisesti, ei kukaan voi puolustaa minua asettuen Jumalaa vastaan, eikä minulla ole muuta turvapaikkaa kuin Hänen tykönään;
null.verse 72:23: julistan vain Jumalan ilmoituksen ja Hänen sanomansa.» Jos joku ei noudata Jumalan ja Hänen sananjulistajansa tahtoa, odottaa häntä totisesti helvetin tuli, ja hänen on iäti oltava siinä,
null.verse 72:24: aina siksi, kunnes ihmiset saavat kokea sen, millä heitä uhattiin, ja tulevat tuntemaan, kumman auttaja on heikompi ja lukumäärältään vähäisempi.
null.verse 72:25: Sano: »En tiedä, onko jo lähellä se, millä teitä on uhattu, vai onko Herra siirtänyt sen määräajaksi.
null.verse 72:26: Hän tietää silmiltä salatut, mutta ei ilmoita salaisuuksiaan muille
null.verse 72:27: paitsi valitsemalleen sananjulistajalle, ja tälle Hän asettaa suojelijan käymään hänen edellään ja samoin hänen jäljessään
null.verse 72:28: ollakseen varma, että he todella ovat julistaneet Herransa sanoman; Hän käsittää kaiken, mitä heissä on, ja Hän pitää lukua kaikesta.»

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:1: Dis [ô Muhammad] : " Il m'a été révélé qu'une troupe de djinns ont prêté l'oreille et se sont écriés : "Certes, nous avons entendu un Coran merveilleux !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:2: "Il guide dans la bonne direction ; nous y avons cru et nous n'associerons aucun être à notre Seigneur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:3: "Notre Seigneur, en vérité, - que Sa grandeur soit exaltée ! - ne s'est donné ni compagne, ni enfant !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:4: "L'un d'entre nous, un insensé, a prononcé au sujet de Dieu des choses aberrantes.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:5: "Nous pensions que ni les hommes, ni les djinns ne pouvaient proférer un mensonge contre Dieu,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:6: "mais il y a eu parmi les hommes des individus qui se sont mis sous la protection de djinns mâles, lesquels n'ont fait qu'augmenter leur trouble.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:7: "Ils pensaient alors, comme vous, que Dieu ne ressusciterait personne.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:8: "Nous avons touché le ciel et l'avons trouvé rempli de gardiens redoutables et de dards flamboyants.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:9: "Nous nous étions postés sur des sièges pour écouter ; mais quiconque désormais veut écouter rencontre un dard flamboyant qui le guette.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:10: "Nous ne savions donc pas si l'on voulait du mal aux habitants de la terre, ou si leur Seigneur voulait qu'ils soient bien guidés.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:11: "Parmi nous, il y en a qui sont vertueux tandis que d'autres ne le sont pas ; nous suivons des voies divergentes.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:12: "Nous pensions bien que nous ne saurions affaiblir la puissance de Dieu sur la terre et que nous ne l'affaiblirions pas en prenant la fuite.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:13: "Aussi, lorsque nous avons entendu la Guidance, nous y avons cru. Quiconque croit en son Seigneur ne craint ni d'être lésé, ni d'être opprimé.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:14: "Il y en a parmi nous qui sont soumis à Dieu (muslimûn) et il y en a qui sont rebelles." " Ceux qui se sont soumis ont embrassé avec ferveur la bonne direction.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:15: Quant aux rebelles, ils seront du bois pour la Géhenne.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:16: S'ils s'étaient maintenus sur la voie droite, Nous les aurions abreuvés d'une eau abondante,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:17: façon de les mettre à l'épreuve. Mais quiconque se détourne du rappel de son Seigneur, Dieu l'achemine vers un châtiment implacable.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:18: Les mosquées sont consacrées à Dieu. N'y invoquez donc personne à côté de Dieu.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:19: Quand le Serviteur de Dieu s'est levé pour L'invoquer, peu s'en fallut qu'ils ne l'étouffent en se pressant autour de lui.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:20: Dis [ô Muhammad] : " Je n'invoque que mon Seigneur et je ne Lui associe personne ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:21: Dis : " Je n'ai le pouvoir ni de vous faire tort ni de vous bien guider ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:22: Dis : " Nul ne me protège contre Dieu, et en dehors de Lui, je ne trouverai pas d'asile,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:23: sauf en transmettant la parole de Dieu et Ses messages ". Quant à ceux qui désobéissent à Dieu et à Son Envoyé, le feu de la Géhenne leur est destiné. Ils y demeureront à jamais !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:24: Quand ils verront enfin la réalisation de ce qui leur a été promis, ils sauront qui est le plus faible en secours et l'inférieur en nombre.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:25: Dis : " Je ne sais si ce qui vous est promis est proche, ou bien si mon Seigneur lui assignera un délai.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:26: Il connaît parfaitement le Mystère ; mais Il ne lève pour personne le voile de Son mystère,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:27: sauf pour celui qu'Il agrée comme envoyé. Celui-là, Il le fait accompagner de gardiens placés devant et derrière lui,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 72:28: afin de savoir s'ils [les envoyés] ont transmis les messages de leur Seigneur. Sa Science s'étend à tout ce qui les concerne, et Il fait le compte exact de toute chose ".

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 72:1: Dis : «Il m’a été révélé qu’un groupe de djinns prêtèrent l’oreille, puis dirent : «Nous avons certes entendu une Lecture [le Coran] merveilleuse,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 72:2: qui guide vers la droiture. Nous y avons cru, et nous n’associerons jamais personne à notre Seigneur.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 72:3: En vérité notre Seigneur - que Sa grandeur soit exaltée - ne S’est donné ni compagne, ni enfant !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 72:4: Notre insensé [Iblis] disait des extravagances contre Dieu.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 72:5: Et nous pensions que ni les humains ni les djinns ne sauraient jamais proférer de mensonge contre Dieu.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 72:6: Or, il y avait parmi les humains, des mâles qui cherchaient protection auprès des mâles paris les djinns mais cela ne fît qu’accroître leur détresse.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 72:7: Et ils avaient pensé comme vous avez pensé que Dieu ne ressusciterait jamais personne.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 72:8: Nous avions frôlé le ciel et Nous l’avions trouvé plein d’une forte garde et de bolides.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 72:9: Nous y prenions place pour écouter. Mais quiconque prête l’oreille maintenant, trouve contre lui un bolide aux aguets.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 72:10: Nous ne savons pas si on veut du mal aux habitants de la terre ou si leur Seigneur veut les mettre sur le droit chemin.
